pages.text: Scrolls of Identification can greatly simplify the process of divining the nature of an unknown spell, simply reading its incantations over the unknown spellbook or scroll will uncover its contents. $(br) However, they are a rare and finite resource. This is due to the fact that the process of creating such scrolls were lost to the ravages of time- they can now only be found or

traded for, at a great price. It's possible to cast a spell without understanding it, but only the most brave (or foolish?) wizards rely on such methods, as the results can vary from inconvenient to catastrophic. $(br)  It's possible to cast a spell without knowing it, but only the most brave (or foolish?) wizards rely on such methods as the results can be catastrophic. $(br) Fortunately, a group of resourceful wizard scholars

have invented a method to study their newfound spells in a less risky fashion. Their fervent research resulted in a new tool - the Sphere of Cognizance. What are wizards without their crystal balls anyhow?$(br) The Sphere of Cognizance can be an essential tool for identifying unknown spells.$(br) By fuelling the process with raw magic crystals and concentrating their mind on the Sphere, a wizard can learn clues regarding the very

nature of the spell which was put under the Sphere, without casting it. Not only can the elemental affinity of the spell be revealed this way, but also the its purpose - be it a summoning incantation, or a protective aura around the caster.
There is also a slight chance to discover the spell's name. The Sphere can be an useful addition to a wizard's arsenal of magical tools - and a mysterious, fancy decoration to a library of spells

pages.title: Sphere of Cognizance
pages.text: The Sphere can be crafted at a crafting table
